content.title: Brachial Artery Anatomy
content.description: Main artery of the arm, continuation of axillary artery from lower border of teres major to its bifurcation in the cubital fossa into radial and ulnar arteries.
content.course: Runs along medial side of upper arm, becomes more superficial as it descends, crosses anterior to elbow

boundaries.distal: Bifurcation in cubital fossa, 1cm distal to elbow crease

branches.profunda_brachii: Largest branch, accompanies radial nerve in spiral groove

relations.median_nerve: Crosses from lateral to medial (forms an 'X' with artery)

clinical_applications.blood_pressure: Standard site for auscultatory BP measurement

content.termination: Bifurcates into radial and ulnar arteries in cubital fossa
